messages.original:
A Ukrainian UAV attack on the Ilsky refinery in Krasnodar Krai is currently ongoing. There are reports of a fire burning in the area. Russian air defence is currently working on the UAVs from the Primorsko-Akhtarsk - Severskaya area, which is the source of the explosions heard there. 
A U.S. RQ-4B Global Hawk reconnaissance drone was operating over the Black Sea earlier, guiding the Ukrainian drones to their targets in Crimea and Krasnodar Krai.

Launch of 3 Ukrainian Flamingo cruise missiles, likely from Tuzly or somewhere in southern Odessa Oblast.   It remains unclear if these launches were for combat use, as the missile has not yet been reported in any confirmed strike, though the activity appears‚Ä¶

Three Ukrainian flamingo cruise missiles, probably launched from Odesa Oblast, targeted a Russian Army Barracks near the village of Voloshyne, northern Crimea. Local sources report that the barracks partially burned down.
Satellite imagery has now been published showing significant damage to the complex, confirming the reports. This is the first confirmed usage of the Flamingo missile so far.
Satellite imagery credit: 
https://t.me/Crimeanwind/85519

https://t.me/Crimeanwind/85519

Ukrainian UAVs have impacted Sevastopol Airport in Crimea. Multiple explosions were heard, and a large fire is now burning.   Explosions were also heard in the area of Saki Airbase, where three smaller fires are burning. It is unclear if these fires are from‚Ä¶

Satellite imagery shows that as a result of the Ukrainian UAV attack on Crimea on August 30, Simferopol Airport was hit. The imagery shows two impact points with traces of burning where 1 Mi-8 and 1 Mi-24 helicopter were previously stationed. 
Imagery credit: 
https://t.me/avivector/2944

Russian Geran-2 drones once again attacked the city of Pavlohrad, Dnipropetrovsk Oblast. The main target appears to be the Pavlohrad Chemical plant, where detonations of rocket fuel were observed. 
More details later.

In the Kostyantynivka direction, Ukrainian forces advanced and recaptured previously lost positions in the village of Predtechyne.
Following the Russian capture of Predtechyne, Ukrainian forces were able to constrain the Russian attacks on positions surrounding Kostyantynivka, slowing their advance and regrouping the remainder of their FPV drone operators who were outside the city, in the city. After the last section of the Siversky Donets line fell, Russian forces began focusing on capturing positions outside the large, fortified forest southeast of Stupochky, and then storming it. Neither of these goals were achieved. 
After their successful defence in the forest, Ukrainian forces then attempted a series of counterattacks towards the highway northwest of Predtechyne, but were unsuccessful. However, this did tie up Russian forces in the area and eventually led to the Russians attempting to advance towards the eastern dachas of Kostyantynivka. Nevertheless, Ukrainian forces were able to consolidate in the forest north of the highway and began advancing towards Predtechyne. They secured isolated positions west of the village, before entering it and taking up positions in the western houses. Russian forces, who had supply issues due to the increase in Ukrainian FPV drone attacks from Kostyantynivka, withdrew to the eastern houses. 
+ ~9.09 km¬≤ in favour of Ukraine.

In the Dobropillya direction, Ukrainian forces continued to quickly advance and have made additional progress towards the goal of eliminating the rest of the Russian salient.
Ukrainian forces advanced in two areas. In the west, following Russian withdrawals to shorten the line of contact, Ukrainian forces advanced from their newly recaptured positions west of Rubizhne and northeast of Stepy, recapturing the rest of the treelines on the tactical heights. From there, forces from 12th Special Forces Brigade "Azov" advanced from the treelines north of Vilne, and cleared part of the Velyka Balka Gulley. They then crossed the Hruzke River, capturing further positions in the forest plantations, and entered the village of Kucheriv Yar. It is currently unclear if they were able to establish a permanent presence in the settlement, however. Additionally, Ukrainian forces advanced from their positions south of Zolotyi Kolodyaz and cleared the northernmost part of the Velyka Balka Gulley, facilitating the entry into Kucheriv Yar.
In the east, after capturing the treelines on the tactical heights west of Toretske, Ukrainian forces from the 93rd Mechanised Brigade advanced north down the gulley south of Hruzke, forcing the remaining Russian formations stationed east of the Shakhove - Hruzke road to withdraw to positions in the treelines south of Kucheriv Yar. 
+ ~15.57km¬≤ in favour of Ukraine.

In the Novopavlivka direction, over the past week both Russian and Ukrainian forces have been advancing north of the Vovcha River.
Russian forces were able to cross the Vovcha River and took up positions in the forests southwest of Fillya. After reinforcements were brought in, they began storming the village of Fillya. They entered the southern houses and took up positions there. Ukrainian forces, utilising the trench fortifications in the forest to the north were able to hold the northern part of the settlement, and launched a few counterattacks, however these were repelled. Russian forces responded by dropping several FAB glide-bombs on this forest. 
To the east, Ukrainian forces continued their slow advance towards Dachne. They completed the capture of the forest west of the village, and secured positions in the treeline to the east. Other forces then advanced south from the treelines in the area of the highway and captured the large trench fortification on the northern approaches to the village. This fortification was then used to enter Dachne, where they captured the western houses. The rest of the settlement is in the grey zone. 
+ ~5.23km¬≤ in favour of Russia.
+ ~4.32 km¬≤ in favour of Ukraine.

Yesterday evening and overnight, around 18 Russian Geran-2 drones attacked Donetsk Oblast. Impacts were recorded in Druzhkivka, Kostyanytnivka, Dobropillya, and Ivers'ke. Media 1 shows a Geran impact in Druzhkivka. Media 2 shows a fire burning in Kostyantynivka.

Yesterday evening and overnight, around 18 Russian Geran-2 drones attacked Donetsk Oblast. Impacts were recorded in Druzhkivka, Kostyanytnivka, Dobropillya, and Ivers'ke. Media 1 shows a Geran impact in Druzhkivka. Media 2 shows a fire burning in Kostyantynivka.

Last night, Russia carried out a Geran-2 drone attack on Kyiv Oblast. At least 12 impacts were recorded, 10 of which were in Bila Tserkva, along with a minimum of 2 in the area of Fastiv. 
Gerbera (parody) drones played a significant role in decreasing the number of Gerans being shot down by Ukrainian air defence. Videos are all from Bila Tserkva.

Last night, Russia carried out a Geran-2 drone attack on Kyiv Oblast. At least 12 impacts were recorded, 10 of which were in Bila Tserkva, along with a minimum of 2 in the area of Fastiv. 
Gerbera (parody) drones played a significant role in decreasing the number of Gerans being shot down by Ukrainian air defence. Videos are all from Bila Tserkva.

For the first time in over a month, I'm now fully caught up with Ukraine map updates. Expect much less of a delay in the coming days as I'm able to cover the newest developments. 
Also, as per usual, I will release my report on the monthly changes on the battlefield for the month of August tomorrow, September 2nd (New Zealand Time), but in light of recent developments with Ukraine retaking ground that Russia initially took within the past month, I'd like to remind you all that the monthly changes report covers net gains for each side. Ukrainian advances that took place on territory Russia occupied within that same month will simply be subtracted from the Russian total.

This morning, a large-scale Ukrainian UAV attack was carried out on the Kuybyshev Refinery in Samara Oblast. Despite Russian air defence activity from mobile crews stationed at the refinery, multiple drones were able to impact, and a massive fire broke out‚Ä¶

Satellite imagery shows that as a result of the Ukrainian UAV strikes on Kuibyshev Oil Refinery in Samara Oblast on August 28, 2 tanks burned down, and the AVT-4 unit responsible for the first stage of crude oil processing was also damaged. 
It appears that firefighting efforts had a major effect on the damage, as despite the massive size of the fire seen in the videos, the damage appears to be fairly minimal.

A Ukrainian UAV attack on the Ilsky refinery in Krasnodar Krai is currently ongoing. There are reports of a fire burning in the area. Russian air defence is currently working on the UAVs from the Primorsko-Akhtarsk - Severskaya area, which is the source of‚Ä¶

All Ukrainian UAVs which attempted to strike the Ilsky Refinery in Krasnodar Krai were shot down, however at least one impact was recorded to a 330 kV electrical substation near the town of Kropotkin. A fire is now burning there, which was picked up on NASA FIRMS. 
Coordinates
: 45.440963, 40.520798
